content.description: Sit start on wide side pulls. Make a couple compression moves until you can reach the horizontal slot with your left hand. Then get out of the pool!
content.location: In the middle of the boulder. Look for the obvious pointy jug start of Clubbing Baby Seals, then look right about 10 feet. You should see some low chalked side pulls.

content.description: Sit start low on a thin horizontal edge. Move left then upwards through horizontal cracks to the topout.
content.location: East side of the boulder in the middle of the face. Several feet to the right of the pointed jug and diagonal ledge.

content.description: Sit start on the pointed jug in the middle of the face. Make moves up and left through horizontal cracks to a committing topout.
content.location: East side of the boulder in the middle of the face. Look for a distinct pointed jug down low.

content.description: Start low at a small block. Move upwards into an under-cling, and use that to get yourself into the upper horizontal crack. Beware the topout as the ground is uneven.
content.location: East side of the boulder, and on the left side of the face. About 10 feet left of the pointed jug in the middle of the face.

content.description: Sit start at the small ledge. Climb through good slopers and jugs all the way to the top. Be careful not to pull on the loose triangular boulder midway through the climb, it could go anytime. It's marked with a big white X(chalk).
Start on a eye level seam and pull over the lip.
content.location: This boulder is found uphill and to the right of "Year of the Cockroach."  The Greenpeace problem is on the backside adjacent to "Buddha Belly."

content.description: Start sitting at a decent incut edge for your left hand and a bad sidepull for the right, with poor feet.  Make a hard move to the good rail, then into the stand start.
content.location: Near the right side of the uphill face of the boulder.  Descend via easy but crusty slab off the opposite (downhill) side of the boulder, or jump off near the top of the problem.

content.description: Sit start at the flexing flake. Move right to the shelf and work your way up. Avoid the loose triangular boulder midway up, it could go anytime.
Start matched on a low diagonal flake. Fire up left to a decent edge, before continuing upward on slopers. Save something for the slopey mantel.
content.location: West side of the boulder and one of the first lines visible coming up the trail. Look in the lower part of the face for an overhanging arch with a black streak through the tip.

content.description: Sit start on the pointed jug, and make moves upwards to the horizontal crack. From here, traverse right along a couple different cracks and finish on slopers above the nearby V4.
content.location: East side of the boulder, in the middle of the face on a pointed jug.
